Thanks for putting this together Steve. I see why it makes sense to have a premium offering for higher net worth people, but our mission is to make Solar a reality for every American (with the help of the IRA). 

It‚Äôs middle income Americans who can least afford to be taken for a ride by a Solar pirates, and scaling a model that enables everyday people to benefit from Solar also gives us access to the largest TAM. 

Whoever can mold the young hungry novice into an effective community seller will have the ability to scale indefinitely and book Billions in Top line revenue.

I think our premium offering is created organically when we graduate the better sellers into the higher net worth neighborhoods (or poach hitters from other companies).

It‚Äôs only if we embrace our local roots that we can become Americas neighborhood Solar Company üá∫üá∏

Let‚Äôs keep our eyes on the phase 1 prize of 28 deals. Nothing else matters if we can‚Äôt hit those metrics.

Again, a lot of good stuff in there, but let‚Äôs table it until we hit it out of the park with our current sellers. 

Happy to discuss on Monday. 

üè°üåûüí∞

Thanks good feedback on the 2nd video. 

The first video discusses a diff topic and related to getting to 28 - how to solve for the reps being single points of failures  and adding a layer of support. Video 1 above ‚ÄúStrategy for competing‚Äù is specific to a problem I foresee in getting to 28 with 3 existing reps and 1 incoming rep + myself. 

Agree to table second video, but looking to discuss the first and the layer of support concept
I completely agree. The support structure for the sale team is definitely something that requires more evaluation. The possible points of failure for a single resource are worrying

As long as this is something that can be solutioned with existing resources before we kickoff after Labor Day then I‚Äôm all for it. It will just hurt our numbers if we need to hire new people to support our existing folks for Sept.

We have seen how long it takes to find good people.
Agree.

We just need to make sure that our guys know what they are talking about (especially when the leads start coming in). Let test them this week, and then test them again. If you‚Äôre not impressed by their delivery, then keep running them through it, this is the time. Eventually it will click, or we have a bigger problem. 

And as soon as we have the collaterals, let‚Äôs get them out and setting up their strategic partnerships. Let‚Äôs get them a huge objection handling sheet, and have them go out and start talking with business owners. 

Rick has trained up a hundred guys that have gone out and made a living, let‚Äôs lean on him to tell us what we need to hit our goal of 28 signed deals in September. 

I‚Äôm excited, let‚Äôs move forward with the understanding that we have people with the ability and desire to do a good job, the rest is up to us.
Well said

Angi‚Äôs Update: 

6 Angi List leads since Monday. Three came in today.

Could be a Panasonic battery play and also hybrid hot water angle exists after what I learned from calling. Could want all new panels as well

90 percent of Angi‚Äôs leads are looking to fix solar. Only 1 lead (meeting tomorrow) that does not have existing solar
